title: First man on Moon
text: Astronaut Neil Armstrong became the first human to walk on the lunar surface during NASA's Apollo 11 mission.

title: Internet invented
text: A global system of interconnected computer networks, initially developed by ARPA for military and academic research, enabling data exchange.

title: Columbus finding America
text: In 1492, Christopher Columbus's expedition made landfall in the Caribbean, marking the beginning of sustained European contact with the Americas.

title: Inside
text: Born in Ajaccio, Corsica, Napoleon Bonaparte entered the world on August 15, 1769, just a year after the island was ceded to France by Genoa.

title: Invention of light bulb
text: While many contributed, Thomas Edison's 1879 patent for a practical, long-lasting incandescent light bulb revolutionized homes and cities, ushering in a new era of illumination.

title: Queen elizabeth born
text: Queen Elizabeth I of England was born in 1533, a monarch who reigned for over four decades and became one of England's most iconic rulers.

title: Muhammad Ali
text: A towering figure of the 20th century, Muhammad Ali transcended boxing to become a global icon of sports, activism, and individuality, known for his dazzling speed, knockout power, and unwavering principles.

title: Afganistan war Sojvetunion
text: The Soviet-Afghan War, from 1979 to 1989, was a protracted conflict involving the Soviet Union and Afghan mujahideen forces supported by various countries. It led to immense destruction and loss of life in Afghanistan.
